channel.title: Apollo
channel.description:
[center][img]http://apollo-server.tumblr.com/photo/1280/656823617/1/tumblr_l3e6rtcBdj1qc81qx[/img][/center]
[b]Introduction:[/b]
Some of you may have heard of Apollo from other forums like rune server or rune locus. I haven't really talked about it here, but if you're smart enough you'll be able to search the internet and find some more info.
I have stopped working on Apollo due to other commitments (such as making my own game), therefore I've decided to release what I've got so far in order to help the community.
I'd like to stress that this isn't a finished product, and it isn't for newbies either. Many parts could be improved, and many core parts of the server still need to be written.
[b]Credits:[/b]
[ul][li]Graham - primary author[/li] [li]Blake - wrote a few small portions of the code, also had plenty of discussions with him on msn about the design[/li] [li]Scu11 - wrote some additions, they are not included however as he wasn't happy with all of them, but you could always ask them if you really want them, also he always answered my gameplay questions[/li] [li]Sean - all the discussions we had about the design on msn[/li] [li]varek, super_, lothy, silabsoft and other people from the moparscape veteran section - all the private discussions about different design ideas which inspired parts of Apollo[/li][/ul]
I've probably missed a few people off who gave assistance, so sorry but a lot of the code was written a while ago and I tend to forget who's who due to the number of people that contact me.
[b]License:[/b]
Apollo itself is released open-source under the terms of the ISC license - see the LICENSE file in the distribution for the copyright information and terms. Basically, this means you can do pretty much anything you like [b]so long as you keep the LICENSE file there![/b] Please don't remove it - it took lots of effort from myself and others to make Apollo and we'd really appreciate if you didn't remove the license info and credits.
The dependencies are released under various licenses and you should check their respective licenses.
[b]Download:[/b]
[u][url=http://www.mediafire.com/?w3goikwpox9coli]apollo.tar.gz[/url][/u] (~700kb .tar.gz file)
Mirrors:
[url=http://blakebeaupain.com/bin/apollo.tar.gz]http://blakebeaupain.com/bin/apollo.tar.gz[/url] [url=http://blakebeaupain.com/bin/apollo.zip]http://blakebeaupain.com/bin/apollo.zip[/url] [url=http://www.multiupload.com/W4UNO5FH67]http://www.multiupload.com/W4UNO5FH67[/url]
[b]Brief Setup Instructions:[/b]
First you need to add the cache for your client to the appropriate folder. For 317, add the cache to apollo/data/fs/317. For 377, add the cache to apollo/data/fs/377.
You can build Apollo with Apache Ant and Apache Ivy. First download and setup Ant and Ivy, info on that can be found here: [url=http://ant.apache.org/]http://ant.apache.org/[/url] and here: [url=http://ant.apache.org/ivy/]http://ant.apache.org/ivy/[/url].
In command prompt, in the apollo directory, run these commands:
[code] ant resolve [/code]
"ant resolve" only needs to be called once when you first download Apollo and again when you update the versions of the dependencies. It downloads third-party libraries such as JRuby and Netty.
[code] ant build [/code]
"ant build" compiles all the source files.
[code] ant run [/code]
"ant run" starts the server running, by default it tries to load the 377 cache and packet codecs. You can change this by editing the version attribute in the build.xml file, or by running it manually without ant.
Other ant targets you may find useful:
doc - generates javadocs, if you have graphviz installed it also includes nice graphs of the class hierarchy test - runs (the very limited set of) unit tests

@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Graham, post:155, topic:423390”][quote author=The Outsider link=topic=526031.msg3843441#msg3843441 date=1323446066]
Graham. Do you encourage people, when they download Hyperion/Apollo etc., to carry on in the same fashion as you did when creating the server, or think it’s fine to use their own style?
[/quote]

I would definitely encourage people to carry on in the same style but it isn’t like I can do much about it.[/quote]
I always try to follow what you do when I am using Hyperion, but these bad habits PI gave me are making me do it all wrong… Although what Hyperion teaches me can help make my PI not suck as bad…

Read full topic
